turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Now tell me you love me.

turns.speaker: HOGAN
turns.text: Lemme down, bugface!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: That's not even close.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: HOGAN
turns.text: Get away from me, freak!

turns.speaker: HOGAN
turns.text: How are you doing, kid?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh, look, Mr. Hogan, I'm really sorry about what happened in there. Really--

turns.speaker: HOGAN
turns.text: You can be great, kid, just stick with it. But let me give you one little piece of advice... be a good guy.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: Too hip.  Your photos suck, kid.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I think you're trying to tell me something.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Come on, that's pure luck!  The guy was in the right place at the right time--

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: You make your own luck, Parker! Get into the middle of things, spend every day pounding the pavement of the city's mean streets--

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You taking extension classes, Mr. Jameson?

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: Parker-- you go here, right?  Got your camera?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah--

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: Get inside and get pictures.  Fifty bucks.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Can we make it a hundred?

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: Seventy.  But I want blood and gore.  You know, sexy stuff.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Can't focus...

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: Gimme that.  Pick it up later.

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: I bet you don't think I appreciate you, Parker.  I do.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Well, thanks.  You wouldn't believe what I went through to get those. Right after you took my camera, this ambulan--

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: I like enthusiasm.  That's why I use a lot of smart-ass kids.  Not just 'cause they work cheap.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Mr. Jameson--

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: I got a question, college boy.  What the hell am I supposed to do with these!?  I ask for disaster, pathos, what do I get?  Salvador Dali!  When I want artsy-fartsy double-exposures, I'll ask for--

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Double-exposures? But they're not-- I was in--

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: I don't give a gerbil's ass how you got 'em!  I can't print this surreal garbage!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You print pictures of Bigfoot!

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: Bunch of kids at your goddamned college say their appliances attacked them.  Did you get pictures?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Mr. Jameson--

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: No! Washington Square, manhole covers turn into flying saucers and radios explode like A-bombs.  Did you get pictures?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Can I get a word in edgewise?

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: No!  Now get outta my face, kid.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Relax, Jameson.  This is business. I know you want photos of me, so I'll give your boy Parker an exclusive.  On one condition--

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: I don't submit to blackmail!  The first amendment protects my freedom to tell the news as I imagine it, and--

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Would you cool it already?

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: Police, help!  Po-- mmph.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Thank you.  Now, repeat after me-- Spider-Man is a good guy. On the side of right, and niceness, and cute baby animals and all that.

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: Frmpph-yrr.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Oh, that?  It'll come unstuck in a half-hour or so. Your mouth needs the rest.  Bye.

turns.speaker: JAMESON
turns.text: Hmf-hrr?

turns.speaker: LEIBER
turns.text: No refund on the mask, y'know. Health laws.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Uh-huh. Look, this should be skintight.  Bright colors.  Red, maybe a deep midnight blue.

turns.speaker: LEIBER
turns.text: What's this? A cockaroach?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: A spider.  Eight legs.

turns.speaker: LEIBER
turns.text: Eh.  Week from tomorrow.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: How about tomorrow?

turns.speaker: LEIBER
turns.text: You're making my life difficult.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Two suits by tomorrow for $400?

turns.speaker: LEIBER
turns.text: An even five I throw in the jacket.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Deal.  But don't tell anyone.  I want to keep a low profile.

turns.speaker: LETTERMAN
turns.text: Is that bug juice, or are you just glad to see me?

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Sorry. I'm still getting the hang of this.

turns.speaker: LETTERMAN
turns.text: I see.  So, Amazing Spider-Man-- I'll assume that's not your given name--

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Just call me Spidey.

turns.speaker: LETTERMAN
turns.text: Can I get you a snack-- a housefly, maybe?

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Thanks, I already ate.

turns.speaker: LETTERMAN
turns.text: I'll hate myself in the morning for asking, but what exactly makes you any more amazing than the average jerk on the street?

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: LETTERMAN
turns.text: All right, amazing.  Are you quite finished?

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Just about.  You see, I also have this amazing strength...

turns.speaker: LETTERMAN
turns.text: Are you quite finished?

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Just about.  See, I also have this amazing strength.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: He left.  I couldn't believe it-- he just left!  It's as if he's somewhere else... I'm only getting a piece of him.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: When Peter was little, he loved to hide.  In closets, under the sink. He needed a secret place.  But when I'd look for him, he'd laugh... he wanted to be found.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I don't think he wants me to find him.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Maybe I was hiding.  For years, I never told Ben the one important thing.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: He knew.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Some things you should say anyway.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Even if they're not clever.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Even if you've heard them a million times in every stupid pop song ever written.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: What if you get hurt?

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: What if the world ends tomorrow?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Good morning, Liz.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: How very dull, Peter Parker.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It's too early to be clever.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: It's never too early to be clever. Describe in a sentence how you feel about me.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Fill in the blank: "I blank Elizabeth Allan."

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I-- uh--

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Uh is a good start.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I lov-loathe Elizabeth Allan. Abhor, detest, despise--

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Oh.  Well, I hate you and everyone who looks like you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I hate the Platonic idea of you.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I hate people with alliterative names.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I hate--

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I hate your relatives, I hate your coffee, I hate your shoes.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: No.  I was lying about the coffee.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Thank God.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: -- but the dogs treed him between Huxley and Kafka.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Poor Harry.  Always desperate for attention.  What about the bunny?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Back to the lab.  Harry'll probably lose his scholarship.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: He'll weasel out of trouble. Again.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Maybe.  I could have stopped it, though.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Since you're feeling guilty, why not donate your pretzel to somebody who needs it?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: My my.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Yeah.  Really gets to you if you let it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I suppose.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You want to give them something, but they'll just buy more Ripple. And they smell so... bad.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: God, Flash can be such a jerk.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: But you like that in a man?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You should write that one down.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: "Flash," Liz.  You're going out with something that calls itself "Flash."

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Some prep school thing.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Does it have a human name?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Eugene.  Admit it, Peter-- you'd do anything for a nickname like "Flash."

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'd never admit that.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Hurry up, Flash!

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: What are you doing this weekend?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I've gotta study.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Oh. Maybe I should, too--

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Eat alone, gotta read. Social defense tactic 17  Peter, that jacket is foul.  Lose your glasses?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hi, Adele.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Brrr.  It's colder than New Hampshire in here.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm sure you kept warm.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Don't misquote Othello at me. Besides, you'd have to care about somebody to strangle them.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: What's your problem?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I've got no problems.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Sit down and stop being such a child.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: This from a girl who still plays with dolls.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: That wasn't clever.  That was just nasty.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: What's in the bag?  Garbage?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Sort of.  I'm returning the-- that outfit that you hated so much. Maybe I can get my money back.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Oh, don't do it on my account--

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No, it wasn't only you-- it -- it just wasn't my style.  Hey, look-- let's go to lunch.  Someplace nice for a change.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: This from a man who winces at the cost of a pretzel?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: That was then.  I'm better since the lobotomy.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: -- but at least Aunt May's okay now. I really have to stop by the hospital this afternoon.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Do you mind if I come too?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I think I'd like that.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: They keep saying there's nothing I could've done.  That's a lie.  I could've done something.  If only I'd paid attention to my feelings.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You're not trained for that.  None of us are... I mean, sometimes I...  Okay, let's say you had gone back. What then?  Are you bulletproof?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Well, no.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: So?  The next day I'd read, "Peter Parker murdered," and I'd feel...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You'd feel what?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Listen.  You think you're responsible for everything that happens.  Don't flagellate yourself - and don't flatter yourself, either.  You're not the center of the universe. You're just... Peter.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Am I?  I'm not so sure.  I used to be sure of a lot of things.  Oh, different things from week to week, but now-- I'm not sure of anything anymore.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I know what you mean.  I...

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Hello.  Earth to Peter.  Are you listening?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Unh-huh.  Excuse me.  I've gotta go.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm sorry about being a jerk this afternoon.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Just shut up and close your eyes. This'll hurt.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: May's much better. She'll be out soon.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh, God, I forgot to--

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Ssh.  I always thought she was a strong person.  She is-- but not for the reasons I thought.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Strong...

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Her cleverness, that hard edge-- maybe they're the weakest part of her. The strong part is what's underneath.  The part she was protecting.  There's no reason to protect it... I think she's just finding that out now.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Peter?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm here...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hello, Liz.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Hello.  So very boring.  Peter Parker, how do you feel about me this morning?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I... I like you.  A lot.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Hm.  Well, I like you, too.  I like your aunt.  I like your shoelaces. I like--

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hold it.  Can we stop being clever, just for a moment?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: This may be the end of a beautiful friendship, you know.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Nah.

turns.speaker: MAROTTA
turns.text: You were the last one to see Thorkel.  In Octavius' hospital room.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: So you've found Thorkel?

turns.speaker: MAROTTA
turns.text: Some of him char-broiled bones. Teeth. We ruled out suicide.  Any bad blood between him and Ock?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Octavius wasn't the murderer type.

turns.speaker: MAROTTA
turns.text: But you said he went off a little, after the accident, when those mechanical arms--

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Waldos.

turns.speaker: MAROTTA
turns.text: Right. We have reason to believe he also robbed an armored truck and killed two men. With the waldos.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Lieutenant, I've triangulated recent bizarre events-- the Bronx, Jersey, Brooklyn-- all rippling out from--  Here.  The E.S.U. Science Center. Octavius' experiment seems to have opened a hole in space-time, drastically changing the interrelation between molecular binding, electromagnetism and gravity--

turns.speaker: MAROTTA
turns.text: Yeah, that's fascinating, but I'm just a fat, dumb cop lookin' for a psycho killer--

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: There's an infinitely greater danger. If--  Listen.  The only thing Octavius cares about is repeating his experiment.  To do that, he needs a radioactive catalyst, SL 270.

turns.speaker: MAROTTA
turns.text: Toxic dumps, huh.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: And he'll need a cyclotron.  He can't use ours-- he's already destroyed it.  Guard every nuclear accelerator on the Eastern Seaboard.  New Haven, Long Island, two in Cambridge--

turns.speaker: MAROTTA
turns.text: You sure about all this?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: I know him.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: MAROTTA
turns.text: It's a lot of ground to cover. We'll try.  Funny coincidence, huh?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: No such thing as coincidence.  "God does not play dice with the universe."

turns.speaker: MAROTTA
turns.text: Einstein, right?  We'll see ya.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Peter-- my condolences.

turns.speaker: MAROTTA
turns.text: Yeah, Roz.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Any sign of our friend?

turns.speaker: MAROTTA
turns.text: Nope.  Maybe he skipped to Rio. Feds got troops surrounding every cyclotron on the continent.  Are you absolutely positive that one at E.S.U. is kaput?

turns.speaker: MAROTTA
turns.text: Roz? Rosomoff?  What is it?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Precise equipment such as waldos

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: There's nothing in there worth stealing!

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: That's the understatement of the year.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Aunt May, you're trespassing.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Your records are older than you are.  Have you never heard of new wave?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: When I moved out, you swore up and down you wouldn't meddle--

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Oh, Peter. A zit.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I am old enough to--

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: --but I didn't feel like getting to know your roaches.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'll introduce you.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Ick.  And those foul chemicals in the pots--

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm a photographer, remember?

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Anyway, I've decided to kidnap you for dinner in Forest Hills--

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It's Friday night...

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Yes.  Do you have a date?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: The record--

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: It'll shut itself off.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Tofu.  Ben, I wish you wouldn't.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh, not that.  You promised you'd burn it.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: You were adorable.  The least you could do is use a glass.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Absolutely no class.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Funny thing happened after my physics class today. Harry Osborn--

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Use a fork.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: A match made in heaven.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: See?  You big dullard.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Peter, you're bleeding.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It's fine.  Tell me what--

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Oh, Ben gets through everything.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Aunt May, what happened?

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: I was napping on the couch.  There was a voice and a shot.  I woke up. Ben was looking at me.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: How is he?

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: He'll be fine. They won't tell me anything, but I'm sure he'll be fine.

turns.speaker: NURSE VOICE
turns.text: Poison emergency.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hi.  I've got sort of a hypothetical question.  Do you suppose the bite of a radioactive spider would transmit that spider's proportional strength and agility?

turns.speaker: NURSE VOICE
turns.text: Is this some sort of Zen thing?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I mean, I suddenly have immense physical power, and the ability to crawl up walls--

turns.speaker: NURSE VOICE
turns.text: Do ya? Lemme give you the number for Bellevue.  That's 561-5151--

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah, a psychiatric hospital. Listen, I'm serious--

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: Ha.  Anti-gravitational particles.

turns.speaker: THORKEL
turns.text: Power down.  I need to talk to you.

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: Proof.  Proof of a unified field. Not just theory and equations-- experimental proof.

turns.speaker: THORKEL
turns.text: Let's talk in the hall.

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: In this obsolete little cyclotron, I'm solving the greatest physics problem of the 20th Century.  With more power, I could--

turns.speaker: THORKEL
turns.text: I've had an extremely bad day, Octavius.  A sophomoric prank in the library and punitive measures.

turns.speaker: THORKEL
turns.text: Then the alumni reports came in-- fund-raising is down this year.

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: I couldn't care less.  What I've done is--

turns.speaker: THORKEL
turns.text: What you've done is make the entire physics department look foolish. You compare yourself to Einstein; your colleagues compare you to Bozo the Clown.

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: This is the unified field!  All the forces of the universe tied together-- perfectly!

turns.speaker: THORKEL
turns.text: You've used up your grant. The electric bills alone exceed your annual salary.  Not to mention the potential hazards of your radioactive fuel.

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: I don't care.  Cretin.

turns.speaker: THORKEL
turns.text: That Nobel Prize will just have to wait.

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: THORKEL
turns.text: Then you'll be glad to know the University has decided not to press criminal charges against you. Breaking and entering the minor matter of the total destruction of a 23 million dollar cyclotron

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: I will finish what I've begun

turns.speaker: THORKEL
turns.text: Doubtless.  And you'll have all the time in the world to pursue your work.   Somewhere else.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Otto, I don't like Thorkel any more than you do.  But he has got a point.

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: Rosomoff, I have better things to do than teach Introductory Physics to mindless adolescents.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Perhaps. But every now and then someone pays attention.  You did.

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: No.  No thank you.  I have work.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: I heard about Thorkel's order--

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: I left a paper in my desk.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: A bit melodramatic but if you could prove it that would tie in your unified field theory, the Big Bang, Kaluza-Klein--

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: Ach, theories!  This was first hand, experiential knowledge, the essence of the universe.

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: My self.  I don't matter.  This human life, all life- insignificant.  Bodies-- bags of sleepy, sluggish flesh.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: All right, we may be insignificant, imperfect creatures-- but we're all we've got.

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: You're wrong.  Just for a moment, I heard, saw, felt-- I became Creation.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Creation? Or its opposite?

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: Truth. Pure, eternal.  Beyond the boundaries of mere mortality.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Otto, we are mere mortals. You must never forget your own limits--

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: I'll repeat the experiment.  I will hold the truth. That's the only thing that matters.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: No. It isn't.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Life and death matter. Yours-- everyone's.  By comparison, our search for truth is only a product of curiosity, a game--

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: Oh, Roz.  My mind is so far beyond yours now.  I could beat you at chess now.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: My God, Otto, you have to hear me! The world we know will collapse! Everything we have devoted our lives to-- all patterns, all harmonies-- will be destroyed!

turns.speaker: OCK
turns.text: Truth.  Truth alone exists. Truth must be released...

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: You have no right!  This is cosmic suicide!

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Mr. Parker.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hi, Professor.  What's up?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Peter, what can I do for you?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: An extension on that astronomy paper?  Because, uh...

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Your dog ate it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Actually, I got this spider bite

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Pretty lame for such a smart kid.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Really, Professor, I--

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Fortean phenomena.  Anomalies in our so-called reality. Weirdness, my boy, and lots of it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Caused by Doc Ock's experiment?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: How much do you know about it?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Not a lot.  I saw inside of the Science Center.  What exactly happened?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Only Octavius knows for sure.  And last time I spoke to him, he was on the planet Whiz-Bang.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Need any more help?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: No, thank you.  I'm sure you've got your own problems.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: This photo you took of "Spider-Man" -

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Luck.  The right place at the right time.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Really.  I'd like to speak with him.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I don't think I'll be running into him.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: You never know.  Go get some sleep.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'll try. Thanks.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: The paper, my boy.  A solid B-plus.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh. Yeah.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: If you really apply yourself, you'll get an A next time.

turns.speaker: REISS
turns.text: Kid, you were terrific.  Max Reiss, novelty acts.  Was that judo or something?  Ah, skip it.  Question is, can you do it again?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh-- I don't know-- thanks, Mr. Reiss, but--

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hello, uh, Mr. Reiss?  I'm-- I'm the guy who wrestled Hulk Hogan the other day.  The guy in the mask?

turns.speaker: REISS
turns.text: I was hoping you'd call, babe. Look, you got representation?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No

turns.speaker: REISS
turns.text: Good. We'll make it oral for now. Meet me at Rockefeller Center at six tonight.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Why? It is a wrestling match, or

turns.speaker: REISS
turns.text: Letterman show, NBC. We'll talk then.  Bye.

turns.speaker: REISS
turns.text: Where'd you get the clown suit?

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Like it?

turns.speaker: REISS
turns.text: Nah.  The big mask was better.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: So they're airing this tonight?

turns.speaker: REISS
turns.text: Yup.  Oh, here's your check, minus my commission.  Solid, solid novelty act.

turns.speaker: REISS
turns.text: ... a couple a drinks at Sardi's?

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: REISS
turns.text: I asked if you felt like a drink--

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: No.  No, I-- my aunt and uncle. Something's wrong  --  I need to make a phone call.

turns.speaker: REISS
turns.text: Okay, kid. Call me tomorrow.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Mr. Reiss-- I need a quarter--

turns.speaker: REISS
turns.text: I just gave-- yeah, sure.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: I sent for  the police.  We can explain.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Explain that some jerk in a mask and costume fought a mad scientist with four tentacles?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Right.  Let's go.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: You're sure you're all right.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Yeah, just a lung full of New Jersey.  Lucky you showed up when you did.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Logic.  Lot 49 is the closest stockpile of SL 270--  I do feel foolish talking with a man dressed like a--

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Imagine how I feel.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Excuse me if I'm impertinent, but-- how did you become whatever it is you are?

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: The usual.  Heredity and environment.  What's the deal with Doc Ock?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: He'll try to finish his experiment.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: And blow up the universe just to prove he's right?  Bit egotistical, isn't it?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: A messianic complex is nothing new to Octavius. In  his universe, there's only one mind-- his own. It must be very lonely.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Forgive me if I don't feel too sympathetic right now.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: I listened to him talk of eternal truth and thought of the Bhagavad Gita, the Indian holy book-- "I am become Shiva, Death-- the destroyer of worlds."  Octavius was...

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Bonkers.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Loonytunes.  And yet...

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Just drop me off here.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Do you... live around here?

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: No, but I've got this secret identity to worry about. I'll swing the rest of the way.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: I see.  Well, Octavius won't get much further. They'll catch him and... put him away.  Sad.  He might very well have the truth.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Phooey on that.

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Spider-Man, be careful!  He's quite mad.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: I'm not so happy myself.

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Professor, you ever fly one of these things before?

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: Sure, in the war.  Pull those cables--

turns.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
turns.text: Up here, Docky Ocky!

turns.speaker: ROZ
turns.text: No, no!  Not there!

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: Don't let him kid you. Cagney couldn't have pulled a sweeter job.  All right, boys. We were waiting in the depot in Frankfurt, see? And there was an ammunition train coming through, the longest ammunition train you ever saw, see? So Dunbar gets himself in the men's room, see? Fixes himself a time bomb, busts open the window and just as the train moves out, lays the thing in there, see? So then, he comes out like nothing's happened and three minutes later you can hear it -- boom! Broke every window in Frankfurt. It was gorgeous!

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: I wouldn't talk about things like that.

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: They never caught on.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: They may. That's why I would keep my mouth shut.

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: What's wrong with him?

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Plenty.

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: How did he ever find out about that ammunition train?

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: You must have shot off your mouth all the way from Frankfurt to here.

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: We did not.

turns.speaker: P.O.W.S
turns.text: Jawohl.

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: Is you all good Nazis?

turns.speaker: P.O.W.S
turns.text: Jawohl.

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: Is you all little Adolfs?

turns.speaker: P.O.W.S
turns.text: Jawohl!

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: Then we shall all zalute Feldwebel von und zu Schulz! About face!

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Maybe just a hint or so. Think hard.

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: I don't have to think. We didn't tell anything to anybody. Not a word. Not until we hit this barrack.
